RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 1 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 92. Allowance Purse 27400. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since June 4 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $12,500 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowanc es)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: CARIBBEAN PLEASURE exchanged contact with Buddy Buddy leaving the gate then rated close inside, started a bid leaving the quarter pole and was eased to the three path on the turn, dug in from the head of the lane and took over the final yards. ENTRY TIME pressured the pace then challenged and took the nod two deep approaching the head of the lane, dug in under steady encouragement to put HONEYQUIST away but was caught in the final yards. The latter closed to the front approaching the seven sixteenths pole and set a pressured pace, was met at the rail midway on the far turn, remained a factor to mid-stretch but relented later yards. ALLEN CAN DO IT gave chase, raced off the rail on the turn and ran evenly in the lane. BUDDY BUDDY exchanged contact with Caribbean Pleasure at the break then chased inside, rounded the turn near the rail and ran evenly in the lane. FIBER STRONG engaged in close early chase, raced in the four path on the turn and showed little in the lane. Per Stewards ruling #173, CARIBBEAN PLEASURE is disqualified from purse money.

ENTRY.NAME: dq-Caribbean Pleasure
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped break,rated close,bid past 1/4,3p turn,up final yards

ENTRY.NAME: Allen Can Do It
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased, raced off the rail on the turn and ran evenly in the lane

ENTRY.NAME: Honeyquist
ENTRY.OWNER: Mammas Boys Thoroughbred Racing Group LLC Ultra Championship Racing LLC and Mill
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pressured pace,met rail mid turn,relented later yards

ENTRY.NAME: Fiber Strong
ENTRY.OWNER: Pascal Lawrence J and Harding Sr Philip Arthur

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 2 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 60. Claiming Purse 15700. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since July 4 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $10,000, For Each $1,000 To $8,000 1 lb. (Races Where Entered For $6,250 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: ABENDEGO took the lead nearing the half mile pole and set a pressured early pace, was met and dueled leaving the seven sixteenths and drew clear of River Royale RVF at the quarter pole, raced near the rail on the far turn, dug in under steady encouragement and just lasted. PINNACLE REEF engaged in close chase through the backstretch, raced in the four path on the turn, dug in to take second in the final yards and just missed the win. DE'S CASTLE gave close chase, rounded the turn at the rail and was outfinished for second the final yards. ROCKING TO HOME gave chase through the backstretch, rounded the turn about the four path, drifted toward the head of the lane then flattened stride. YDOUHAVETOBESOMEAN gave chase, raced at the rail on the turn and showed little in the lane. RIVER ROYALE R V F pressured the pace and dueled at mostly even terms leaving the seven sixteenths pole, but dropped back approaching the quarter and faded off the rail on the turn. Small Paw became extremely fractious in the gate and was a late scratch.

ENTRY.NAME: Abendego
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pressured pace,met and dueled 7/16,clear 1/4,just lasted

ENTRY.NAME: Pinnacle Reef
ENTRY.COMMENT: close chase,4p turn,dug in 1/8,dueled 2nd late,just missed

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 3 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 50. Maiden Claiming Purse 13000. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE, FOUR, FIVE, AND SIX YEARS OLD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $7,500, if for $7,000, allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: KNOBIESMAGICSONDE exchanged contact with Lady Gangster leaving the gate then rated the pace from the end of the chute, was urged away past the five sixteenths pole, raced at the rail on the turn then kept on the bit through the lane. S S FOUR QUEENS gave chase through the backstretch, rounded the turn about the four path and settled for second best. LADY GANGSTER exchanged contact with Knobiesmagicsonde leaving the gate then gave close early chase, raced at the rail on the turn then flattened in the lane. JUNIPER GRACE chased through the backstretch, raced in the three path on the turn and showed little more. UNALTERED gave close early chase but dropped back toward the five sixteenths pole, raced near the rail on the turn and weakened. VIESTE gave chase through the backstretch, rounded the turn about the four path and showed little in the lane. OWLHOOT gave chase and rounded the turn about the six path. PRETTY CASTLE gave only distant chase while saving ground.

ENTRY.NAME: Knobiesmagicsonde
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped break,rated pace,urged away 5/16,rail turn,on bit lane

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: James W. Shawyer & Mary Butts Shawyer

ENTRY.NAME: Lady Gangster
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped break,close early chase,rail turn,flattened lane

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 4 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 65. Claiming Purse 11800. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since July 4 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. NO WVB CLAUSE.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: QUEEN CASHMERE was bumped leaving the gate then gave chase through the backstretch, rounded the turn about the four path, dug in leaving the eighth pole and took the lead in later yards. STOPWATCHSONNY gave chase inside, raced at the rail on the turn and dueled for second while outfinished for the win. HOWSAFEAREMYCOLORS ducked out and made contact with Charlotte Webley at the break, gave chase through the backstretch, raced in the four path on the turn and finished well to take the nod for third under the wire. SEEMS TO WHISPER gave chase and raced two deep while between horses on the turn, was outfinished in the duel through the stretch then nipped from third under the wire. ULTIMATE BREEZE gave chase outside, rounded the turn about the six path and finished strong outside. CHARLOTTE WEBLEY was bumped outward and into Queen Cashmere leaving the gate then gave chase, rounded the turn off the rail, eased out leaving the turn and finished well. KYMMIES CHARDONNAY came away sharply and moved to the inside to rate the pace, came under pressure from the five sixteenths pole, rounded the turn at the rail, was met toward mid-stretch and gave way. GRAM'S GAL chased through the backstretch, appeared off stride past the five sixteenths pole and weakened on the turn. LADY SPARROW gave chase, raced in the four path on the turn and showed little in the lane.

ENTRY.NAME: Seems to Whisper
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Ronney W and Cefalu John

ENTRY.NAME: Howsafearemycolors
ENTRY.COMMENT: ducked out,bumped break,chased,4p turn,nod 3rd wire,finished well

ENTRY.NAME: Charlotte Webley
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped break,chased,off rail turn,eased out 1/8,finished well

ENTRY.NAME: Queen Cashmere
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped break,chased,4p turn,dug in lane,up later yards

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 5 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 61. Maiden Special Weight Purse 26500. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE, FOUR, FIVE, AND SIX YEARS OLD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: JUBASLILBALLERINA stalked the early pace off the rail, challenged leaving the seven sixteenths pole and raced at even terms from the three eighths, drew clear into the far turn and drew off; handily. GHOST OF ALCINA saved ground, bid leaving the three eighths pole and raced at the rail on the far turn then came along to take second later yards. FAR MORE settled off the rail on the first turn, picked up the chase from the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn near the rail and passed some rivals. XTENDED STREAK rated the pace inside, came under pressure leaving the seven sixteenths pole and dueled from that point, but dropped back toward the quarter pole and weakened. SHEWEARSSTILETTOS settled off the rail on the first turn, gave chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole but flattened in the five path on the far turn. HARLAN'S VALENTINE stalked the early pace about the three path, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole but faded into the far turn. LIME STAR rounded the first turn about the five path and was never a factor. JUGSY raced well back. AFIRE saved ground. RUMORGOINGAROUND rounded the first turn about the five path and was never a factor.

ENTRY.NAME: Shewearsstilettos
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Nicole and Brown Ronney W

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 6 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 82. Claiming Purse 13200. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE SINCE FEBRUARY 4, 2023. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since February 4 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $4,000 Or Less Not Considered In Eligibility)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MISSIONSNINETYNINE rated the pace inside, was met into the backstretch and dueled from that point, contested the advantage at the rail on the far turn and dug in determinedly to retain the nod. RRACE DAY WARRIOR raced four wide on the first turn then stalked two deep leaving the seven eighths pole, moved to even terms into the backstretch and dueled from that point, contested at a close disadvantage off the rail on the far turn and dug in gamely to the finish. MICROSCOPE stalked the early pace inside, bid nearing the three eighths pole and raced at the rail on the far turn, then dueled through the stretch for third. KING THEO rounded the first turn about the three path then saved ground into the second turn, picked up the chase past the seven sixteenths pole, raced in the three path on the far turn, angled to the outside leaving the turn and ran evenly to late stretch before flattening stride. CHARLIE POTATOES rated close to the early pace about the three path, gave chase from the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn in the four path and ran evenly through the stretch. MAKE WAY rounded the first turn in the three path, chased past the seven sixteenths pole, raced off the rail on the far turn and weakened in the lane. CANTAKEITANYMORE showed little response through the backstretch.

ENTRY.NAME: Missionsninetynine
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Ronney W and Cefalu John
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated pace inside,long duel from 1/2,determined nod

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 7 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 88. Allowance Purse 28400. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON A RACE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER, WAIVER CLAIMING, RESTRICTED OR STATE BRED RACES OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since July 4 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since June 4 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $12,500 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: WHAT DOES IT TAKE rated a slim lead inside, came under pressure leaving the seven sixteenths pole, widened at the rail on the far turn and was kept alert through the lane. NOBALLSTWOSTRIKES saved ground then eased out and gave chase from the seven sixteenths pole, raced three wide on the far turn and dueled through the stretch for second. UNCAPTURED KING rated close inside, picked up the chase nearing the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn at the rail and was outfinished in the stretch duel for second. C R'S MANDATE rounded the first turn about the three path then saved ground into the second turn, gave chase leaving the three eighths pole, was blocked at the rail on the far turn and showed little further. FROG TOWN settled off the rail early, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole and rounded the far turn about the four path, then flattened stride. NAPA VALLEY raced five wide on the first turn then stalked two deep from the seven eighths pole, challenged leaving the seven sixteenths but dropped back nearing the quarter pole and flattened off the rail on the far turn. SPUNMAN settled in the three and four paths and showed little response through the backstretch. FIELDSTONE raced off the rail, picked up the chase into the backstretch then weakened in the four path on the far turn. CRYPTIC CODE was distanced.

ENTRY.NAME: Uncaptured King
ENTRY.OWNER: Murdock Stephen and Marceda John A

ENTRY.NAME: What Does It Take
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated slim lead,pressured 7/16,widened turn,kept alert lane

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: Dr. & Mrs. Thomas Bowman & Brooke Bowman

ENTRY.NAME: Spunman
ENTRY.OWNER: Boyer James A and Coleswood Farm Inc

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 8 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 79. Allowance Purse 28400. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since July 4 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since June 4 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $15,00 0 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: LORD OF CORK stalked the pace two deep, rallied to the front approaching the quarter pole, raced at the rail on the far turn and was steadily handled in the lane. PAYMENGOLD exchanged contact with Juba Bound leaving the gate then came further inward to make contact with Road Slew, rounded the first turn about the four path, gave chase leaving the half mile pole and raced in the five path of the far turn, dueled for second mid-stretch and finished well. NOCASHREFUNDS was jostled at the break and raced in the three path the first turn, bid past the half mile pole, rounded the far turn about the three path and dueled through the stretch for third. LOGSTRADAMUS saved ground, picked up the chase past the seven sixteenths pole and raced near the rail on the far turn, eased out leaving the turn but showed little more. MAKIN' GOLD saved ground on the first turn, gave chase leaving the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn off the rail then flattened the final sixteenth. STROLLINGINTHEWIND raced well back inside early on, picked up the chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole, angled to the five path toward the head of the lane and passed rivals in the lane. JUBA BOUND exchanged contact with Paymengold leaving the gate, raced in the three and four paths on the first turn and picked up the chase past the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn in the three path, eased out leaving the turn and showed little further. PERSONABLE came out and exchanged contact with Nocashrefunds leaving the gate, raced off the rail on the first turn and showed little response through the backstretch. ROAD SLEW broke in and made contact with Nocashrefunds and was bumped again a stride later, raced in the four path on the first turn and showed little response through the backstretch. BERTRAM FLIGHT rated the pace inside, came under pressure nearing the seven sixteenths pole and was met approaching the quarter pole, rounded the far turn at the rail and was pinched back nearing the eighth pole.

ENTRY.NAME: Logstradamus
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground,chased 7/16,rail far turn,eased out 1/8,little more

ENTRY.NAME: Nocashrefunds
ENTRY.COMMENT: jostled break,3p 1st turn,bid past 1/2,3p far turn,dueled 3rd

ENTRY.NAME: Juba Bound
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped break,3& 4p 1st turn,chased 7/16,3p far turn,empty lane
